These convenient appliances have become essential in modern kitchens, and when they malfunction, meal preparation routines are significantly disrupted.
At Sears Home Services, we understand both the technical complexities of Samsung microwaves and the inconvenience these problems cause in your daily life. Our factory-trained Samsung microwave repair technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the Samsung lineup, from countertop units to sophisticated built-in and over-the-range models with convection and smart features.
Understanding How Your Samsung Microwave Works
Samsung microwaves combine precision engineering with innovative features designed to enhance cooking convenience. At their core, these appliances generate microwave energy through a magnetron, which creates electromagnetic waves that excite water molecules in food, producing heat.
Modern Samsung models enhance this basic function with sophisticated features like sensor cooking technology that detects humidity levels and automatically adjusts cooking time and power. Many units incorporate convection capabilities that use heating elements and fans to circulate hot air, enabling baking and roasting functions beyond traditional microwave cooking.
Built-in and over-the-range Samsung microwaves also feature ventilation systems with multi-speed fans to remove cooking odors and smoke from your kitchen. These models often include integrated lighting systems to illuminate the cooking surface below.
The control panel, whether using touch-sensitive controls or a combination keypad, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the microwave's command center. This sophisticated component processes user inputs and manages all functions from power levels to cooking cycles.
Understanding these specialized components helps explain why Samsung microwaves require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this integrated system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
Common Samsung Microwave Problems and Their Causes
Heating Issues
"My Samsung microwave runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
Magnetron Failures: The magnetron generates the microwave energy that heats your food. When this critical component fails, the microwave may run through its cycle but produce no heat. Warning signs include unusual humming noises, decreased heating efficiency, or complete heating failure.
Diode Malfunctions: The high-voltage diode works with the magnetron to produce microwave energy. When it fails, heating becomes inconsistent or stops completely. This component often fails before the more expensive magnetron.
Capacitor Problems: The high-voltage capacitor stores electricity to power the magnetron. Failures can cause intermittent heating or complete loss of heating function while other features like the turntable and light continue to work.
Door Switch Issues: Samsung microwaves have multiple safety door switches that must engage properly for the unit to heat. Misaligned or faulty switches can prevent heating while allowing other functions to operate normally.
If your Samsung microwave isn't producing adequate heat, our Sears appliance repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
Control Panel and Electronic Issues
Modern Samsung microwaves feature sophisticated electronics that can develop several distinct issues:
Unresponsive Touchpad: Touch controls may become partially or completely unresponsive due to control board issues, membrane switch failures, or moisture intrusion. Sometimes specific buttons stop working while others function normally.
Display Malfunctions: The digital display may show garbled information, partial characters, or go completely blank while other functions still operate.
Error Codes: Samsung models display specific codes to indicate problems:


"SE" indicates a keypad short circuit


"E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing


"E-21" relates to smart sensor malfunctions


Random Operation: In some cases, the microwave may start or stop unexpectedly or change settings during operation, indicating control system problems.
For persistent control panel issues or error codes, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.
Mechanical and Operation Issues
Samsung microwaves incorporate several mechanical systems that can develop problems:
Turntable Malfunctions: The glass tray may stop rotating due to drive motor failures, worn drive couplers, or misaligned support wheels.
Noisy Operation: Unusual sounds might indicate fan motor problems, worn roller guides, or magnetron issues. Different noises point to specific components—buzzing often relates to the magnetron, while grinding might suggest turntable mechanism problems.
Ventilation Problems: In over-the-range models, fan failures or clogged exhaust pathways can reduce ventilation efficiency while cooking on the range below.
Door Latch Issues: Problems with the door latch assembly can prevent proper closing or cause the interlocking safety system to fail, preventing microwave operation.
When your Samsung microwave experiences mechanical failures, our microwave repair technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair.
Light and Ventilation Problems
Over-the-range and built-in Samsung models incorporate cooking surface lighting and ventilation systems that can malfunction:
Light Failures: Surface lights may burn out, develop socket issues, or experience wiring problems that prevent proper operation.
Ventilation Problems: Fan motors can fail, speed controls might malfunction, or exhaust pathways can become obstructed with grease and debris over time.
Charcoal Filter Saturation: In recirculating ventilation systems, overly saturated charcoal filters can significantly reduce odor removal effectiveness.
These components enhance the functionality of over-the-range models, and their proper operation is important for the overall kitchen environment. Our repair services include comprehensive assessment of these specialized features.
Try These Steps Before Calling for Samsung Microwave Repair
Before scheduling professional service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues:
1. Reset the Electronic Controls


Disconnect power for 2 minutes (unplug the unit or turn off the circuit breaker)


Restore power and test operation


For persistent issues, consult your owner's manual for model-specific reset procedures


2. Check the Door Switches


Clean the door latch area to remove food debris that might prevent proper closing


Verify that the door closes securely and the latch engages completely


Listen for the click of door switches when opening and closing


3. Inspect the Turntable System


Remove the glass tray and support wheel


Clean the central hub and support track


Check for damage to the drive coupler


Reinstall components properly and test operation


4. Test Basic Functions


Try different power levels and functions to identify pattern of malfunction


Note any error codes that appear on the display


Listen for unusual sounds during operation


5. Verify Proper Power Supply


Ensure the unit is properly plugged in


Check for tripped circuit breakers


Test the outlet with another appliance


Regular microwave appliance maintenance can prevent many common problems and extend the life of your Samsung appliance.
When to Call for Professional Samsung Microwave Repair
Consider professional service when:


Heating problems persist after basic troubleshooting


The microwave makes unusual arcing or sparking sounds


Control panel issues prevent normal operation


Error codes appear repeatedly


Mechanical problems affect turntable or ventilation operation


The door doesn't close or latch properly


Burning smells occur during operation


Professional repair becomes particularly important for:
High-Voltage Component Issues: Microwave power systems operate at potentially dangerous voltage levels and should only be serviced by qualified technicians.
Complex Electronic Controls: Samsung's sophisticated control systems often require specialized diagnostic equipment and technical knowledge.
Built-In Unit Repairs: Over-the-range and built-in models present installation challenges that demand professional expertise for safe removal and reinstallation.
If your Samsung microwave shows signs of serious malfunction, professional diagnosis will identify the underlying cause and provide safe, effective repairs.
The Sears Home Services Samsung Microwave Repair Experience
When you choose Sears Home Services for your Samsung microwave repair, you're getting comprehensive support from experienced professionals:
Before Your Appointment:


Our scheduling team helps select a convenient service window


We recommend having your model number ready (typically found inside the door or on the back of the unit)


You'll receive appointment reminders and technician arrival updates

Our microwave repair experts understand the importance of this essential kitchen appliance and provide service that restores functionality quickly and safely.
Prevent Future Problems with These Samsung Microwave Maintenance Tips
Keep your microwave running smoothly with these maintenance practices specifically designed for Samsung models:


Clean the interior regularly – Wipe down surfaces after spills, and deep clean weekly with mild soap and water


Clean the door seals monthly – Gently remove food particles and grease that could affect door alignment


Avoid running the microwave empty – Always have food or liquid in the unit when operating


Clean the turntable components weekly – Remove and wash the glass tray and support wheel


Inspect ventilation grilles quarterly – Ensure airflow isn't restricted by dust or grease build-up


Clean the grease filters monthly – In over-the-range models, remove and wash filters to maintain ventilation efficiency


Replace charcoal filters as recommended – For recirculating ventilation systems, replace filters every 6-12 months


These maintenance practices help preserve your Samsung microwave's performance and extend its lifespan. For more detailed maintenance, schedule microwave appliance cleaning and maintenance through Sears Home Services.
Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Samsung Microwave Repair
Our technicians receive specialized training on Samsung's unique technologies, including their sensor cooking systems, convection features, and electronic control platforms. This specific expertise ensures we can accurately diagnose and repair issues across every Samsung microwave model.
We understand that a malfunctioning microwave disrupts your kitchen routine and meal preparation. That's why our service is designed to be efficient, effective, and as convenient as possible—getting your Samsung microwave back to perfect operation with minimal disruption.
What sets us apart is our commitment to not just fixing the immediate problem, but helping you understand how to maintain your Samsung microwave's performance for years to come. We succeed only when your microwave is working perfectly, and you have the knowledge to keep it that way.
For problems beyond regular maintenance, our expert microwave repair technicians can diagnose and repair even the most complex issues.

Understanding How Your Samsung Microwave Works
Samsung microwaves combine precision engineering with innovative features designed to enhance cooking convenience. At their core, these appliances generate microwave energy through a magnetron, which creates electromagnetic waves that excite water molecules in food, producing heat.
Modern Samsung models enhance this basic function with sophisticated features like sensor cooking technology that detects humidity levels and automatically adjusts cooking time and power. Many units incorporate convection capabilities that use heating elements and fans to circulate hot air, enabling baking and roasting functions beyond traditional microwave cooking.
Built-in and over-the-range Samsung microwaves also feature ventilation systems with multi-speed fans to remove cooking odors and smoke from your kitchen. These models often include integrated lighting systems to illuminate the cooking surface below.
The control panel, whether using touch-sensitive controls or a combination keypad, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the microwave's command center. This sophisticated component processes user inputs and manages all functions from power levels to cooking cycles.
Understanding these specialized components helps explain why Samsung microwaves require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this integrated system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
Common Samsung Microwave Problems and Their Causes
Heating Issues
"My Samsung microwave runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
Magnetron Failures: The magnetron generates the microwave energy that heats your food. When this critical component fails, the microwave may run through its cycle but produce no heat. Warning signs include unusual humming noises, decreased heating efficiency, or complete heating failure.
Diode Malfunctions: The high-voltage diode works with the magnetron to produce microwave energy. When it fails, heating becomes inconsistent or stops completely. This component often fails before the more expensive magnetron.
Capacitor Problems: The high-voltage capacitor stores electricity to power the magnetron. Failures can cause intermittent heating or complete loss of heating function while other features like the turntable and light continue to work.
Door Switch Issues: Samsung microwaves have multiple safety door switches that must engage properly for the unit to heat. Misaligned or faulty switches can prevent heating while allowing other functions to operate normally.
If your Samsung microwave isn't producing adequate heat, our Sears appliance repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
Control Panel and Electronic Issues
Modern Samsung microwaves feature sophisticated electronics that can develop several distinct issues:
Unresponsive Touchpad: Touch controls may become partially or completely unresponsive due to control board issues, membrane switch failures, or moisture intrusion. Sometimes specific buttons stop working while others function normally.
Display Malfunctions: The digital display may show garbled information, partial characters, or go completely blank while other functions still operate.
Error Codes: Samsung models display specific codes to indicate problems:


"SE" indicates a keypad short circuit


"E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing


"E-21" relates to smart sensor malfunctions


Random Operation: In some cases, the microwave may start or stop unexpectedly or change settings during operation, indicating control system problems.
For persistent control panel issues or error codes, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.

Common Samsung Microwave Problems and Their Causes
Heating Issues
"My Samsung microwave runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
Magnetron Failures: The magnetron generates the microwave energy that heats your food. When this critical component fails, the microwave may run through its cycle but produce no heat. Warning signs include unusual humming noises, decreased heating efficiency, or complete heating failure.
Diode Malfunctions: The high-voltage diode works with the magnetron to produce microwave energy. When it fails, heating becomes inconsistent or stops completely. This component often fails before the more expensive magnetron.
Capacitor Problems: The high-voltage capacitor stores electricity to power the magnetron. Failures can cause intermittent heating or complete loss of heating function while other features like the turntable and light continue to work.
Door Switch Issues: Samsung microwaves have multiple safety door switches that must engage properly for the unit to heat. Misaligned or faulty switches can prevent heating while allowing other functions to operate normally.

Control Panel and Electronic Issues
Modern Samsung microwaves feature sophisticated electronics that can develop several distinct issues:
Unresponsive Touchpad: Touch controls may become partially or completely unresponsive due to control board issues, membrane switch failures, or moisture intrusion. Sometimes specific buttons stop working while others function normally.
Display Malfunctions: The digital display may show garbled information, partial characters, or go completely blank while other functions still operate.

Listen for the click of door switches when opening and closing


3. Inspect the Turntable System


Remove the glass tray and support wheel


Clean the central hub and support track


Check for damage to the drive coupler


Reinstall components properly and test operation


4. Test Basic Functions


Try different power levels and functions to identify pattern of malfunction


Note any error codes that appear on the display


Listen for unusual sounds during operation


5. Verify Proper Power Supply


Ensure the unit is properly plugged in


Check for tripped circuit breakers


Test the outlet with another appliance


Regular microwave appliance maintenance can prevent many common problems and extend the life of your Samsung appliance.
When to Call for Professional Samsung Microwave Repair
Consider professional service when:


Heating problems persist after basic troubleshooting


The microwave makes unusual arcing or sparking sounds


Control panel issues prevent normal operation


Error codes appear repeatedly


Mechanical problems affect turntable or ventilation operation


The door doesn't close or latch properly


Burning smells occur during operation


Professional repair becomes particularly important for:
High-Voltage Component Issues: Microwave power systems operate at potentially dangerous voltage levels and should only be serviced by qualified technicians.
Complex Electronic Controls: Samsung's sophisticated control systems often require specialized diagnostic equipment and technical knowledge.
Built-In Unit Repairs: Over-the-range and built-in models present installation challenges that demand professional expertise for safe removal and reinstallation.
If your Samsung microwave shows signs of serious malfunction, professional diagnosis will identify the underlying cause and provide safe, effective repairs.
The Sears Home Services Samsung Microwave Repair Experience
When you choose Sears Home Services for your Samsung microwave repair, you're getting comprehensive support from experienced professionals:
Before Your Appointment:


Our scheduling team helps select a convenient service window


We recommend having your model number ready (typically found inside the door or on the back of the unit)


You'll receive appointment reminders and technician arrival updates


During Your Service Visit:


Our technician conducts a thorough diagnostic assessment


You'll receive a clear explanation of the problem in everyday language


We present repair options with upfront pricing—no hidden charges


Our technicians use quality replacement parts ensuring proper fit and function


After Your Repair:


The technician verifies proper operation through comprehensive testing


You'll receive customized maintenance recommendations for your specific Samsung model


We stand behind our work with a satisfaction guarantee


Your repair is documented for future reference


Our microwave repair experts understand the importance of this essential kitchen appliance and provide service that restores functionality quickly and safely.
Prevent Future Problems with These Samsung Microwave Maintenance Tips
Keep your microwave running smoothly with these maintenance practices specifically designed for Samsung models:


Clean the interior regularly – Wipe down surfaces after spills, and deep clean weekly with mild soap and water


Clean the door seals monthly – Gently remove food particles and grease that could affect door alignment


Avoid running the microwave empty – Always have food or liquid in the unit when operating


Clean the turntable components weekly – Remove and wash the glass tray and support wheel


Inspect ventilation grilles quarterly – Ensure airflow isn't restricted by dust or grease build-up


Clean the grease filters monthly – In over-the-range models, remove and wash filters to maintain ventilation efficiency


Replace charcoal filters as recommended – For recirculating ventilation systems, replace filters every 6-12 months


These maintenance practices help preserve your Samsung microwave's performance and extend its lifespan. For more detailed maintenance, schedule microwave appliance cleaning and maintenance through Sears Home Services.
Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Samsung Microwave Repair
Our technicians receive specialized training on Samsung's unique technologies, including their sensor cooking systems, convection features, and electronic control platforms. This specific expertise ensures we can accurately diagnose and repair issues across every Samsung microwave model.
We understand that a malfunctioning microwave disrupts your kitchen routine and meal preparation. That's why our service is designed to be efficient, effective, and as convenient as possible—getting your Samsung microwave back to perfect operation with minimal disruption.
What sets us apart is our commitment to not just fixing the immediate problem, but helping you understand how to maintain your Samsung microwave's performance for years to come. We succeed only when your microwave is working perfectly, and you have the knowledge to keep it that way.
For problems beyond regular maintenance, our expert microwave repair technicians can diagnose and repair even the most complex issues.
Ready to get your Samsung microwave working perfectly again? Schedule your Samsung microwave repair online now at Sears Home Service or call 1-800-4-MY-HOME to speak with our customer service team.

Our factory-trained Samsung microwave repair technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the Samsung lineup, from countertop units to sophisticated built-in and over-the-range models with convection and smart features.

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"Samsung microwave repair","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair/samsung"}

full_content.content: Understanding How Your Samsung Microwave Works
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: Samsung microwaves combine precision engineering with innovative features designed to enhance cooking convenience. At their core, these appliances generate microwave energy through a magnetron, which creates electromagnetic waves that excite water molecules in food, producing heat.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Modern Samsung models enhance this basic function with sophisticated features like sensor cooking technology that detects humidity levels and automatically adjusts cooking time and power. Many units incorporate convection capabilities that use heating elements and fans to circulate hot air, enabling baking and roasting functions beyond traditional microwave cooking.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Built-in and over-the-range Samsung microwaves also feature ventilation systems with multi-speed fans to remove cooking odors and smoke from your kitchen. These models often include integrated lighting systems to illuminate the cooking surface below.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: The control panel, whether using touch-sensitive controls or a combination keypad, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the microwave's command center. This sophisticated component processes user inputs and manages all functions from power levels to cooking cycles.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Understanding these specialized components helps explain why Samsung microwaves require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this integrated system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Common Samsung Microwave Problems and Their Causes
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: "My Samsung microwave runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Magnetron Failures: The magnetron generates the microwave energy that heats your food. When this critical component fails, the microwave may run through its cycle but produce no heat. Warning signs include unusual humming noises, decreased heating efficiency, or complete heating failure.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Diode Malfunctions: The high-voltage diode works with the magnetron to produce microwave energy. When it fails, heating becomes inconsistent or stops completely. This component often fails before the more expensive magnetron.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Capacitor Problems: The high-voltage capacitor stores electricity to power the magnetron. Failures can cause intermittent heating or complete loss of heating function while other features like the turntable and light continue to work.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Door Switch Issues: Samsung microwaves have multiple safety door switches that must engage properly for the unit to heat. Misaligned or faulty switches can prevent heating while allowing other functions to operate normally.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: If your Samsung microwave isn't producing adequate heat, our Sears appliance repair technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

{"class":"hover:underline hover:underline-offset-4 text-blue-100 focus:outline-blue-1000 text-md font-medium","data-metric-id":"","data-metric-value":"Sears appliance repair","target":"_self","style":"color:blue.7","node":"[object Object]","href":"/repair"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Modern Samsung microwaves feature sophisticated electronics that can develop several distinct issues:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Unresponsive Touchpad: Touch controls may become partially or completely unresponsive due to control board issues, membrane switch failures, or moisture intrusion. Sometimes specific buttons stop working while others function normally.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Display Malfunctions: The digital display may show garbled information, partial characters, or go completely blank while other functions still operate.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Error Codes: Samsung models display specific codes to indicate problems:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
"SE" indicates a keypad short circuit


"E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing


"E-21" relates to smart sensor malfunctions
full_content.attributes: {"class":"list-disc font-normal text-left text-gray-500 text-md leading-6 pl-12 sm:pl-14","node":"[object Object]"}
{"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}
{"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: "E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}

full_content.content: "E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"class":"text-md leading-6 font-montserrat text-left text-gray-500 my-2 first:mt-0 ","node":"[object Object]"}
{"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Random Operation: In some cases, the microwave may start or stop unexpectedly or change settings during operation, indicating control system problems.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: For persistent control panel issues or error codes, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Samsung microwaves incorporate several mechanical systems that can develop problems:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Turntable Malfunctions: The glass tray may stop rotating due to drive motor failures, worn drive couplers, or misaligned support wheels.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Noisy Operation: Unusual sounds might indicate fan motor problems, worn roller guides, or magnetron issues. Different noises point to specific components—buzzing often relates to the magnetron, while grinding might suggest turntable mechanism problems.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Ventilation Problems: In over-the-range models, fan failures or clogged exhaust pathways can reduce ventilation efficiency while cooking on the range below.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Door Latch Issues: Problems with the door latch assembly can prevent proper closing or cause the interlocking safety system to fail, preventing microwave operation.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: When your Samsung microwave experiences mechanical failures, our microwave repair technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}
{"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Over-the-range and built-in Samsung models incorporate cooking surface lighting and ventilation systems that can malfunction:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Light Failures: Surface lights may burn out, develop socket issues, or experience wiring problems that prevent proper operation.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Ventilation Problems: Fan motors can fail, speed controls might malfunction, or exhaust pathways can become obstructed with grease and debris over time.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Charcoal Filter Saturation: In recirculating ventilation systems, overly saturated charcoal filters can significantly reduce odor removal effectiveness.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: These components enhance the functionality of over-the-range models, and their proper operation is important for the overall kitchen environment. Our repair services include comprehensive assessment of these specialized features.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Prevent Future Problems with These Samsung Microwave Maintenance Tips
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-4xl my-2 leading-9 text-blue-300 font-oswald lg:text-4xl-plus font-normal"}

full_content.content: Keep your microwave running smoothly with these maintenance practices specifically designed for Samsung models:
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content:
Clean the interior regularly – Wipe down surfaces after spills, and deep clean weekly with mild soap and water


Clean the door seals monthly – Gently remove food particles and grease that could affect door alignment


Avoid running the microwave empty – Always have food or liquid in the unit when operating


Clean the turntable components weekly – Remove and wash the glass tray and support wheel


Inspect ventilation grilles quarterly – Ensure airflow isn't restricted by dust or grease build-up


Clean the grease filters monthly – In over-the-range models, remove and wash filters to maintain ventilation efficiency


Replace charcoal filters as recommended – For recirculating ventilation systems, replace filters every 6-12 months

full_content.content: Why Choose Sears Home Services for Your Samsung Microwave Repair

full_content.content: Our technicians receive specialized training on Samsung's unique technologies, including their sensor cooking systems, convection features, and electronic control platforms. This specific expertise ensures we can accurately diagnose and repair issues across every Samsung microwave model.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: We understand that a malfunctioning microwave disrupts your kitchen routine and meal preparation. That's why our service is designed to be efficient, effective, and as convenient as possible—getting your Samsung microwave back to perfect operation with minimal disruption.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: What sets us apart is our commitment to not just fixing the immediate problem, but helping you understand how to maintain your Samsung microwave's performance for years to come. We succeed only when your microwave is working perfectly, and you have the knowledge to keep it that way.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: For problems beyond regular maintenance, our expert microwave repair technicians can diagnose and repair even the most complex issues.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Glossary TermsWhat is a Microwave Waveguide Cover?A microwave waveguide cover is a small, often mica or plastic piece inside the microwave that covers the opening where microwaves enter the cooking chamber, protecting the microwave's internal components from food splatter and ensuring efficient distribution of the microwaves.What is a Microwave Diode?A microwave diode is an electrical component that allows current to flow in one direction only, playing a crucial role in converting incoming electrical power into the microwave energy that cooks the food.What is a Microwave Sensor?A microwave sensor is a technologically advanced feature in modern microwave ovens that measures vapor (steam) emitted by the food, adjusting the cooking time and power levels automatically for optimal results.What is a Microwave Magnetron?A microwave magnetron is a component in microwave ovens that generates the microwaves used to cook food.

self.__next_f.push([1,"When your Samsung microwave stops heating, makes unusual noises, or the touchpad becomes unresponsive, it transforms a simple cooking task into a frustrating experience. These convenient appliances have become essential in modern kitchens, and when they malfunction, meal preparation routines are significantly disrupted. 

At Sears Home Services, we understand both the technical complexities of Samsung microwaves and the inconvenience these problems cause in your daily life. Our factory-trained [Samsung microwave repair](/repair/samsung) technicians bring specialized expertise to diagnose and repair every model in the Samsung lineup, from countertop units to sophisticated built-in and over-the-range models with convection and smart features. 

## Understanding How Your Samsung Microwave Works 

Samsung microwaves combine precision engineering with innovative features designed to enhance cooking convenience. At their core, these appliances generate microwave energy through a magnetron, which creates electromagnetic waves that excite water molecules in food, producing heat. 

Modern Samsung models enhance this basic function with sophisticated features like sensor cooking technology that detects humidity levels and automatically adjusts cooking time and power. Many units incorporate convection capabilities that use heating elements and fans to circulate hot air, enabling baking and roasting functions beyond traditional microwave cooking. 

Built-in and over-the-range Samsung microwaves also feature ventilation systems with multi-speed fans to remove cooking odors and smoke from your kitchen. These models often include integrated lighting systems to illuminate the cooking surface below. 

The control panel, whether using touch-sensitive controls or a combination keypad, interfaces with an electronic control board that serves as the microwave's command center. This sophisticated component processes user inputs and manages all functions from power levels to cooking cycles. 

Understanding these specialized components helps explain why Samsung microwaves require technical expertise for proper diagnosis and repair. When problems arise, identifying which part of this integrated system has malfunctioned is crucial for effective solutions. 

## Common Samsung Microwave Problems and Their Causes 

### Heating Issues 

"My Samsung microwave runs but doesn't heat" is the most common concern we hear from homeowners. Heating problems typically stem from several potential sources: 

**Magnetron Failures**: The magnetron generates the microwave energy that heats your food. When this critical component fails, the microwave may run through its cycle but produce no heat. Warning signs include unusual humming noises, decreased heating efficiency, or complete heating failure. 

**Diode Malfunctions**: The high-voltage diode works with the magnetron to produce microwave energy. When it fails, heating becomes inconsistent or stops completely. This component often fails before the more expensive magnetron. 

**Capacitor Problems**: The high-voltage capacitor stores electricity to power the magnetron. Failures can cause intermittent heating or complete loss of heating function while other features like the turntable and light continue to work. 

**Door Switch Issues**: Samsung microwaves have multiple safety door switches that must engage properly for the unit to heat. Misaligned or faulty switches can prevent heating while allowing other functions to operate normally. 

If your Samsung microwave isn't producing adequate heat, our [Sears appliance repair](/repair) technicians can diagnose and resolve these heating system problems safely and effectively. 

### Control Panel and Electronic Issues 

Modern Samsung microwaves feature sophisticated electronics that can develop several distinct issues: 

**Unresponsive Touchpad**: Touch controls may become partially or completely unresponsive due to control board issues, membrane switch failures, or moisture intrusion. Sometimes specific buttons stop working while others function normally. 

**Display Malfunctions**: The digital display may show garbled information, partial characters, or go completely blank while other functions still operate. 

**Error Codes**: Samsung models display specific codes to indicate problems: 

- "SE" indicates a keypad short circuit 

- "E-24" signals a thermistor issue affecting temperature sensing 

- "E-21" relates to smart sensor malfunctions 

**Random Operation**: In some cases, the microwave may start or stop unexpectedly or change settings during operation, indicating control system problems. 

For persistent control panel issues or error codes, professional diagnosis ensures the correct component is identified and replaced. 

### Mechanical and Operation Issues 

Samsung microwaves incorporate several mechanical systems that can develop problems: 

**Turntable Malfunctions**: The glass tray may stop rotating due to drive motor failures, worn drive couplers, or misaligned support wheels. 

**Noisy Operation**: Unusual sounds might indicate fan motor problems, worn roller guides, or magnetron issues. Different noises point to specific components—buzzing often relates to the magnetron, while grinding might suggest turntable mechanism problems. 

**Ventilation Problems**: In over-the-range models, fan failures or clogged exhaust pathways can reduce ventilation efficiency while cooking on the range below. 

**Door Latch Issues**: Problems with the door latch assembly can prevent proper closing or cause the interlocking safety system to fail, preventing microwave operation. 

When your Samsung microwave experiences mechanical failures, our [microwave repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service) technicians can quickly identify the cause and implement the appropriate repair. 

### Light and Ventilation Problems 

Over-the-range and built-in Samsung models incorporate cooking surface lighting and ventilation systems that can malfunction: 

**Light Failures**: Surface lights may burn out, develop socket issues, or experience wiring problems that prevent proper operation. 

**Ventilation Problems**: Fan motors can fail, speed controls might malfunction, or exhaust pathways can become obstructed with grease and debris over time. 

**Charcoal Filter Saturation**: In recirculating ventilation systems, overly saturated charcoal filters can significantly reduce odor removal effectiveness. 

These components enhance the functionality of over-the-range models, and their proper operation is important for the overall kitchen environment. Our repair services include comprehensive assessment of these specialized features. 

## Try These Steps Before Calling for Samsung Microwave Repair 

Before scheduling professional service, several troubleshooting steps might resolve minor issues: 

### 1. Reset the Electronic Controls 

   - Disconnect power for 2 minutes (unplug the unit or turn off the circuit breaker) 

   - Restore power and test operation 

   - For persistent issues, consult your owner's manual for model-specific reset procedures 

### 2. Check the Door Switches 

   - Clean the door latch area to remove food debris that might prevent proper closing 

   - Verify that the door closes securely and the latch engages completely 

   - Listen for the click of door switches when opening and closing 

### 3. Inspect the Turntable System 

   - Remove the glass tray and support wheel 

   - Clean the central hub and support track 

   - Check for damage to the drive coupler

self.__next_f.push([1,"## What is a Magnetron?

A magnetron is a type of vacuum tube that generates microwaves using the interaction between a stream of electrons and a magnetic field. 

Originally developed in the 1920s for radar technology, magnetrons made their way into home microwave ovens in the 1940s. The magnetron is the device responsible for producing the high-frequency radio waves that we know as microwaves. 

In microwave ovens, these waves penetrate food, causing the water molecules inside to vibrate rapidly, which generates heat through friction of molecules colliding together and cooks the food.

## How Does a Magnetron Generate Microwaves?

The magnetron might look like a small, unassuming part of your microwave oven, but it contains complex components that create powerful electromagnetic waves. Here’s a breakdown of how it works.

* __Electron Emission:__ Inside the magnetron, there’s a filament or cathode, which, when heated, releases electrons. This filament is typically made of tungsten or another metal that can withstand high temperatures.
* __Magnetic and Electric Fields:__ Surrounding the cathode are magnets and an anode, which create magnetic and electric fields. The magnetic field, generated by powerful permanent magnets, is perpendicular to the electric field inside the tube.
* __Electron Oscillation:__ The electrons emitted by the cathode are drawn toward the positively charged anode. However, due to the magnetic field, they do not travel in a straight line. Instead, the electrons are forced into a spiral or circular path around the anode.
* __Cavities and Resonance:__ The anode is shaped with several hollow cavities. As the electrons spiral around, they pass these cavities, which are precisely tuned to resonate at microwave frequencies, usually around 2.45 GHz (the frequency used in most microwave ovens).
* __Microwave Generation:__ As the electrons pass by the cavities, they induce an oscillating electric field within them, generating microwave radiation at the cavity’s resonant frequency. The microwaves are then guided out of the magnetron and into the cooking chamber of the microwave oven.

![how-a-microwave-oven-works-image](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/1cBaXaOd9nf97CkGzPoO0j/2aa9d620963231754d3fb9a1dcb6f1cf/how-a-microwave-works-image.png)

## Directing the Microwaves to the Food

Here’s the process that a microwave oven uses to heat food:

* Once the microwaves are produced, they travel through a small metal tube known as a waveguide. 
* The waveguide channels the microwaves from the magnetron into the cooking chamber. 
* From there, the microwaves bounce around, reflecting off the metal walls of the chamber until they encounter food. 
* When they reach the food, the waves penetrate the surface and cause the water molecules to vibrate, heating the food quickly and efficiently.

## Why Do Microwaves Heat Food So Quickly?

The efficiency of microwave heating lies in molecular friction. Water molecules in food are polar, meaning they have positive and negative ends.

 When exposed to microwaves, these molecules attempt to align with the rapidly changing electric fields, causing them to spin and vibrate millions of times per second. This motion creates heat due to friction, which then spreads throughout the food.

Since the microwaves penetrate the outer layers and heat the food from the inside and out, they cook or reheat food much faster than conventional ovens, which rely on transferring heat through conduction from the outer surface inward.

## Safety Features of Magnetrons

Because magnetrons generate high-energy radiation, microwave ovens are equipped with several safety features:

* __Shielded Chamber:__ Microwave ovens have metal-lined doors and walls that prevent microwaves from escaping.
* __Door Interlocks:__ The oven’s door has switches that disable the magnetron if the door is opened, ensuring that microwaves don’t accidentally leak out.

These features make modern microwaves safe for everyday use, allowing the magnetron to work its magic only when it’s fully enclosed.

## Maintaining Your Microwave for Safe Operation

Follow the instructions in the owner’s manual for your microwave oven to keep it well-maintained and operating safely. 

Keep the inside of the oven cavity clean and free of splatters. Splatters can cause arc marks inside the cavity. When you see small arc marks inside the cavity, follow the tips in this video to repair the damage:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y-2q2hi_gvk" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

As noted in the video, when you see large arc marks or damage in the microwave oven cavity, schedule [microwave repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service) to have a service technician visit your home and fix the damage.

In addition to keeping the oven cavity of your microwave clean, schedule yearly professional [microwave maintenance](/maintain) to have a Sears Home Services technician visit your home and check all microwave functions, make any necessary adjustments and perform professional cleaning to keep your appliance in top shape and lasting longer.

## Innovations in Magnetron Technology

Though magnetrons have been largely unchanged in domestic microwaves, recent innovations aim to improve their efficiency, precision, and energy consumption. 

Some advanced microwave ovens now use inverter technology, which can adjust the power level for more precise cooking instead of simply turning the magnetron on and off. This improvement allows for more even heating, which reduces the chances of overcooking or creating cold spots in food.

Additionally, solid-state microwave technology, which uses semiconductors to produce microwaves, is emerging as a potential replacement for magnetrons. Solid-state microwaves can be controlled more precisely, allowing for more even heating and better energy efficiency.

## Fun Fact: The Accidental Discovery of the Microwave Oven

Microwave ovens were invented by accident. In 1945, Percy Spencer, an engineer working for Raytheon, was testing radar equipment when he noticed that a chocolate bar in his pocket had melted. Curious, he tested other foods and quickly realized that microwaves generated by the magnetron could heat food. 

By 1947, the first commercial microwave ovens were introduced—though they were massive and cost thousands of dollars. Today’s sleek, affordable microwaves owe their existence to this happy accident.

In summary, the magnetron is an essential part of microwave ovens, creating the microwaves that cook food quickly and efficiently. 

It achieves this through a complex interaction of electron flow, magnetic fields, and carefully tuned cavities, transforming electrical energy into high-frequency waves that heat food from within. 

So next time you use your microwave oven, take a moment to appreciate the magnetron and its fascinating science. This little device is what makes your quick meals possible, blending engineering and physics in a truly remarkable way.
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"Microwaves are convenient kitchen appliances, but like any other electronic devices, they can experience various failures. There are many reasons why your microwave won’t work right. 

Here are common causes and safe resolutions for microwave malfunctions.

## Microwave Won’t Turn On

When the microwave has no power at all, start by making sure that its power cord is plugged in. Next, make sure the electrical outlet is working. Plug a small lamp or appliance into the electrical outlet. If the outlet has no power, reset the house circuit breaker for the outlet. If the outlet is still dead, you’ll need to have an electrician fix the electrical outlet.

If the electrical outlet is okay and power cord is plugged in securely, a failed electronic control board or internal wire failure could be preventing the microwave from powering up. A service technician will need to diagnose and repair these types of failures. You may also consider replacing the microwave when it won’t work at all.

If you have a Samsung microwave needing repair, we can help. Our local technicians offer [Samsung repair near you](/repair/samsung), to get your microwave working again quickly. We also offer repair for most other major brand microwaves.

## Microwave Won’t Start

When the microwave won’t start, one of these failures could be causing the problem.

* __Broken door switch.__ The microwave won’t start unless the control detects that the door is fully shut. A bad door switch won’t accurately detect that the door is closed. A technician will need to replace a bad door switch or you’ll need to replace the microwave when it won’t start due to a bad door switch.
* __Blown internal fuse.__ Internal fuses blow when an electrical short occurs or when the microwave overheats. A service technician will need to diagnose and repair the microwave when an internal fuse blows. Replacing the microwave is another option you can consider.
* __Faulty magnetron.__ The magnetron produces the high-energy waves that heat the food in the microwave. Check the owner’s manual for your microwave when you suspect a magnetron failure. The magnetron in some microwaves has a 10 year part warranty but you have to pay for labor to replace the magnetron. You may consider having the microwave repaired when the magnetron fails and the part is under warranty. If the magnetron isn’t under warranty, you’ll likely need to replace the microwave.
* __Bad diode or high-voltage capacitor.__ The microwave components need to be replaced by a technician when they fail. You may also consider replacing the microwave instead of repairing it.
* __Defective electronic control board.__ A bad control board can prevent the microwave from heating. A technician would need to test the control board output and repair the microwave if it has a defective control board. Replacing the microwave is another option when the appliance has this failure.

## Microwave Won’t Heat

The same failures listed above except for a broken door switch will prevent the microwave from heating while it runs. A technician will need to diagnose and repair the problem or you can replace the microwave when it won’t heat.

## Arc Marks Inside the Microwave

If you notice sparks inside your microwave while it's running, it could be because foil or utensils are inside, or the interior paint could be chipped, exposing the metal of the microwave. If there are spatters of food inside your microwave, they could be continuing to cook when you turn it on, which can also cause sparks. Clean the internal cavity of your microwave thoroughly.

You can repair some types of arc marks and burns using [touch-up paint](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/product/2n6r3jijvj-0026-110/id-72017). 

This video will walk you through that process and show you some ways that you can avoid burning your microwave in the future.

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y-2q2hi_gvk" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

For microwaves that are not stainless steel on the inside, you can repair arc marks up to the size of a quarter using this touch-up paint, but only if the marks appear on the inside walls, the floor, or the ceiling. Don't attempt repairs on the outer frame, or the door. Any repairs to the door or frame could affect the shielding and cause radiation leaks. And don’t attempt repairs on burn marks larger than a quarter, as that could be a sign of a more serious problem and should be checked out by a service technician. Also, don't use this repair on microwaves with a stainless steel the inside, because the paint won’t stick.

If you’re unable to repair arc marks or burns inside the cavity, schedule service by a technician or replace the microwave.

## Microwave Light Won’t Work

A burnt out light bulb often prevents the internal light or cooktop light from working in your microwave. Check the owner’s manual for your model to see if you can replace the light bulb yourself. Follow the instructions in the manual to replace the light if you find that procedure covered. 

In many microwaves, the internal light needs to be replaced or fixed by a service technician. Schedule service or continue to use the microwave without the internal light. You can also replace the microwave when the internal light quits working and you’re unable to safely fix the problem yourself.

If replacing the light bulb doesn’t fix the problem, a wiring failure, bad light socket or defective control could be preventing the light from working. Schedule [microwave oven repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service) or replace it unless you can do without the light.

## Turntable Not Moving

When the turntable in your microwave isn’t rotating, first check that it's properly aligned on the turning mechanism. It can easily become loose and fail to turn properly. Aligning the turntable properly may fix the problem.

Next, check the settings to make sure turntable rotation is selected. Adjust the turntable setting if necessary.

If the above troubleshooting tips don’t help, then a bad turntable motor or a wiring failure could be preventing the tray from rotating. You’ll need to have a service technician diagnose the problem and fix the microwave when the turntable won’t move. You can also replace the microwave.

## Touchpad Not Working

When the touchpad isn’t working, try unplugging the microwave power cord for 3 minutes to reset the electronic control board. Plug the microwave back in to restore electrical power. The touchpad may work normally. If not, you’ll need to have the microwave repaired because the control board or touchpad will likely need replacing. You can also replace the microwave instead of repairing it.

## Microwave Repair Safety

__Don’t attempt microwave repairs that aren’t covered in the owner’s manual.__ Microwaves have a high-voltage capacitor that retains a lethal electrical charge even when the microwave power cord is unplugged. Also, a service technician needs to test the microwave for radiation leakage following any disassembly or repair. Don’t risk your health and safety by attempting DIY microwave repairs.

[Schedule microwave service through Sears Home Services](/repair/microwave-repair-service) when your microwave needs repair.

Because microwaves are inexpensive appliances, it’s often less expensive to replace the unit rather than repairing it. *We can help you with that, too.*

### Replacing Your Microwave

To seamlessly replace your microwave (and other appliances if needed), visit our [Sears.com Upgrade page](https://www.sears.com/upgrade) to conveniently select a new appliance or appliances and get help with special financing.

We’ve consolidated all help, [financing offers](https://www.sears.com/en_us/dap/sears-credit-offers-members.html) and savings into one location on our Upgrade page to make it easy for you to replace your appliances now. No hassles and no waiting.

[Sears carries a wide selection of microwaves and other appliances](https://www.sears.com/appliances/b-1020003) from top brands like Kenmore, GE, Samsung and LG. Get your new home appliances right away.

[Sears Home Services](/) is here to help you manage your home easier whether it involves troubleshooting, repair or appliance replacement. Trust us to help you take care of everything in your house so you can truly enjoy your home.
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"![how-a-microwave-oven-works-image](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/1cBaXaOd9nf97CkGzPoO0j/2aa9d620963231754d3fb9a1dcb6f1cf/how-a-microwave-works-image.png)

## How the Microwave Oven Works

Microwaves work by creating an electromagnetic field in the cooking chamber. This field agitates water molecules in the food, causing them to vibrate quickly and generate heat. This heat is then transferred to other parts of the food, ensuring even cooking. Microwaves cook quickly and efficiently because microwave energy heats only the food, not the whole oven cavity.

Four vital components create the electromagnetic microwave field inside the cooking chamber:

* __Magnetron:__ This electron tube is the microwave’s power source, generating the high-energy electrons that cook your food. The magnetron produces microwaves by channeling electrical energy into a heated filament. This creates a flow of electrons that transmits microwaves into the microwave cavity. The microwaves bounce around through the metal interior cavity of the oven and are absorbed by the food. The microwaves agitate water molecules in the food, causing them to vibrate quickly and generate heat. This heat is then transferred to other parts of the food, ensuring efficient and even cooking.
* __High-voltage transformer:__ This component supplies the high-energy electrical power needed by the magnetron to produce the stream of electrons. 
* __High-voltage capacitor:__ The microwave's capacitor works with a diode to convert the alternating current power output of the transformer to direct current (DC), increasing the voltage to nearly 5,000 volts. This additional voltage is necessary to power the microwave's magnetron.
* __Wave guide:__ The wave guide directs the microwaves from the magnetron into the microwave oven cavity.

Although heat is produced directly in the food by agitating water molecules, microwave ovens don’t cook food from the inside out as many think. When thick foods are cooked, the outer layers are heated and cooked primarily by microwaves while the inside of thick food items is cooked mainly by the conduction of heat from the hot outer layers.

Glass, paper, ceramic, or plastic containers must be used in microwave cooking because microwaves pass through these materials. Although such containers cannot be heated by microwaves, they can become hot from the heat of the food cooking inside them. Generally, metal pans or aluminum foil should not be used in a microwave oven, as the microwaves are reflected off these materials causing the food to cook unevenly and possibly damaging the oven cavity.

If you accidently use foil or metal containers inside the microwave, schedule [microwave repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service) service to have a technician examine the appliance and make sure that it’s safe to continue using.

---

![how-the-convection-oven-works-image](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/2TWcEAhDbSc6GBFelqgD3t/eedf1510321fc4ce819df33842cef77d/how-does-a-convection-oven-work-image.png)

## How the Convection Oven Works

A convection oven uses a fan and heating element to circulate hot air throughout the oven cavity to heat food. Circulating the air around the food promotes even cooking. Although not as fast as microwave cooking, convection cooking does heat items faster than a conventional oven without the fan. An air fryer is a type of convection oven that uses a more powerful fan than the convection oven.

The fan removes moisture from the oven cavity during baking, which helps foods get crisp – something a microwave won’t do. This results in baked goods with crispy crusts and tender insides. It also creates crispy skins on meats.

---

## How the Convection Microwave Oven Combines the Methods

Having the best of both worlds is always better. Although convection microwave has multiple cooking modes so you can use either method on its own, cooking with both methods at once will cook food faster and crispier. While the microwave function quickly heats the food by agitating water molecules using high-energy electrons, the convection element and fan work together to heat the outer layers of the food and create a crispy crust that helps the food retain moisture and stay tender and juicy inside.

Here are distinct advantages of using a convection microwave oven:

* __Faster cook times:__ Items cook faster because the convection element, fan and microwave system heat the food simultaneously in different ways.
* __Even cooking:__ The fan circulates hot air to cook food evenly while the microwaves also do the same. 
* __Moist food:__ Convection cooking helps food retain moisture by creating an outer crust. 
* __Better flavor:__ Convection cooking improves the flavor of food by browning the outer layers and creating crispy skins on meat.
* __Uses less energy:__ Because they cook faster and more efficiently, convection microwaves use less energy than a traditional oven.

---

## Maintaining a Convection Microwave Oven

Follow the instructions in the owner’s manual for your convection microwave oven for maintenance and cleaning. Keep the inside of the oven cavity clean and free of splatters. Splatters can cause arc marks inside the cavity. When you see small arc marks inside the cavity, follow the tips in this video to repair the damage:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y-2q2hi_gvk" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

As noted in the video, when you see large arc marks or damage in the microwave oven cavity, schedule [microwave repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service) to have a service technician visit your home and fix the damage.

In addition to keeping the oven cavity of your microwave clean, schedule yearly professional [microwave maintenance](/maintain) to have a Sears Home Services technician visit your home and check all microwave functions, make any necessary adjustments and perform professional cleaning to keep your appliance in top shape and lasting longer.

---

self.__next_f.push([1,"## Examining the Factors to Consider

The decision to repair or replace a microwave depends on certain crucial factors.

### Age of the Microwave

Countertop and over-the-range microwaves typically last an average of 9-10 years. Built-in microwaves often last more than 15 years. If your microwave is near or past its retirement age, replacing it might be a better option due to the increased likelihood of recurring issues and lack of replacement parts. 

### Type of Microwave

For countertop and microhood models, you’ll almost always be better off replacing the appliance rather than repairing it once its warranty has ended. Microwave repairs can easily match or exceed the replacement cost of these models. 

For a built-in microwave, you’ll typically want to repair the appliance and keep it for as long as possible because it matches the oven and other kitchen appliances. It can be difficult to buy a matching replacement for a built-in microwave.

### Cost of Repairs

If the cost of repairing a microwave comes close to or exceeds the price of a new one, it might make more financial sense to replace it. However, if the costs of repairing are relatively low and the microwave isn’t too old, it could be worth repairing the microwave.

### Frequency of Problems

Frequent malfunctions could indicate that your microwave is nearing the end of its lifespan. In such cases, investing in a new microwave could save you from continuous repair costs.

## Benefits of Repairing a Microwave

Repairing your microwave has several advantages:

* __Cost-effectiveness:__ Repairing a microwave can be more affordable than buying a new one, which can save you money. By repairing your microwave, you can extend its lifespan and avoid the expense of a new appliance – especially for built-in models.
* __Convenience:__ It’s often much more convenient to repair the microwave and keep it instead of shopping, ordering and having a new microwave installed (or installing it yourself if possible). Because you use your microwave practically every day, you’ll likely want the problem fixed quickly through repair.
* __Eco-friendly:__ Opting for repairing a microwave reduces electronic and solid waste, contributing to a more sustainable environment. It helps preserve natural resources, decrease pollution from manufacturing, and reduce the carbon footprint associated with producing new appliances.
* __Maintaining kitchen appliance consistency:__ When your microwave is built-in and you’re unable to find a replacement compatible with your oven and other kitchen appliances, repairing it lets you keep that upscale and functional look in your kitchen.

At Sears Home Services, we have experienced microwave repair experts who can diagnose your microwave and fix it quickly. We have access to repair parts for all major microwave brands. Get in touch today to schedule [microwave oven repair](/repair/microwave-repair-service).

## When Replacing Your Microwave Makes Sense

While there are benefits to repairing a microwave, there are also situations where it might be more practical to replace it.

* __Safety concerns:__ If your microwave shows signs of safety hazards, such as a malfunctioning door or sparks, it’s safer to replace it rather than attempting a repair.
* __Outdated technology:__ Microwaves have evolved over time with new features and improved efficiency. If your microwave lacks these modern functionalities such as air frying, replacing it with an upgraded model could enhance your cooking experience.
* __Desire for a new look:__ If you want a microwave with a more modern look or a sleek model that updates your kitchen, replacing your microwave when it needs repair is the right call for you.
* __Repair is impractical:__ As noted above, it’s often impractical to repair a countertop or over-the-range microwave because the repair will cost more than buying a new model.

![Sears.com Upgrade page image](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/PADBJ0wsbIfXJuqLz3MHZ/b2aebf069596ed45286c859c580e0ff7/Sears_dot_com_Upgrade_page_image.png)

When you need to replace your microwave, visit our [Sears.com Upgrade page](https://www.sears.com/upgrade) to find special offers and financing to help make your appliance replacement easy and seamless. You’ll find appliance package deals that will enable you to transform your entire kitchen all at once.

When pondering whether it is worth repairing a microwave and possibly your other kitchen appliances, remember that the final decision depends on your specific situation and needs.

## Scheduling a Microwave Repair

Consulting with a microwave technician can offer valuable insights into whether a repair is feasible. A technician can diagnose the issue, identify necessary parts, and estimate the cost of repairing a microwave oven.

Obtaining multiple repair quotes allows you to compare prices and determine the best option for your budget. Remember, the cheapest quote isn’t always the best choice; quality and reliability of repairs are important factors too.

Also, consider any manufacturer warranty that may still be valid. Many microwaves come with warranties that cover certain repairs or replacements for a specific period. Checking your warranty can help you determine if the costs of repairing a microwave would be covered partially or fully by the manufacturer.

By seeking expert advice, getting multiple quotes, and considering your warranty, you can make an informed decision and get the best value for your money.

To get the best advice and help with a microwave repair, [schedule service through our Sears Home Services website](/repair/microwave-repair-service). We’ll send an experienced and knowledgeable technician to your home to help you fix your microwave failure.
"])
